channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report E-2023070053
item.description:
Report E-2023070053

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of denatured alcohol (un1987) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal one gallon can had released 1 gallon of product . The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023061528
item.description:
Report X-2023061528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet and was determined to be leaking gasoline. Package was a damaged lawnmower that was being returned to Amerisun Inc. Package smelled of gas and had no HazMat indicators. Package was taken out of the load ends and isolated from the rest of the staff. DescribePack: Package was determined to be a lawnmower that had its gas cap loose, this led to a leak of Hazardous materials. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Package was taken to the HazMat cage for isolation and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023061518
item.description:
Report X-2023061518

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The previously processed hazmat was located in the haz cage appearing to be wet. Further inspection of the package confirmed that one of the bottles inside had a cap that was missing and caused internal release of product. The bottle was completely empty. DescribePack: Cap closure missing and leaving internal liquid contents exposed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed under hood. Evaporated

X-2023061423: RESPONDER USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPOND SHEET TO THEN CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND BRING IT BACK TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023060786
item.description:
Report E-2023060786

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSW experienced a UN3092 1-Methoxy-2-Propanol release from a 55-gallon poly drum due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 50-gallons of product released to an 8' x 53' area of the trailer floor and a 3' x 53' area of the asphalt lot below due to a puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon metal overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. All cleanup debris was then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023061479
item.description:
Report X-2023061479

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: NILES
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was set aside due the side being wet and other sides being partially dried. Upon inspection I could see both bottles of muriatic acid had loose caps causing contents to spill. Package was placed in a plastic tote. DescribePack: Caps failed to hold back contents. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in plastic tote.

item.title: Report X-2023061468
item.description:
Report X-2023061468

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-19T21:09:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-04
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg located inside haz cage inside a tote with note stating the hole leaking. Further inspection confirmed the previously processed hazmat package became damaged and impacted with a sharp object during transit. The drum appears to have been taped to notate where the hole is located as well as try to contain the release and diffuse the strong smell being released. DescribePack: Small hole on bottom of drum close to the bottom rim DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Tape was placed over hole to try to reduce the fumes perfuming from the hole as well as being placed in the haz cage to make sure there is very little movement of liquid being shifted around inside.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was set aside due to leakage for gasoline from box. Upon inspection I could see inside was one lawn mower with a full tank of gasoline. The customer decided to return the lawn mower without taking the gasoline out of the tank. The customer also did not inform anyone of this. Package was set aside to stop further spillage of gasoline. DescribePack: Gas tank cap leaked gasoline. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed aside on kart.

item.title: Report X-2023061119
item.description:
Report X-2023061119

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-17T15:10:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: WEST FRANKFORT
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While unloaded trailer 831523 one of the unloading package handlers moved to unload the HAZMAT package, due to the way it was loaded; on its side against the orientation arrows and with none of the labeling visible, he was unaware it was a HAZMAT until he moved it, also noting that it was wet, he used his stop work authority and stopped unloaded the trailer, letting his partner and scanner know their was a damaged hazmat, leading to the belt being stopped and the manager notified. DescribePack: The exterior packaging only failed because of a faulty seal on one of the caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The exterior packaging managed to soak up all of the release

item.title: Report E-2022110067
item.description:
Report E-2022110067

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-22T00:38:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-10-04
  • City: BRIDGEVIEW
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit due to improper blocking and bracing and that one of the metal 55 gallon drums of epoxy white (un1263) had been damaged and had released 4 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
